Key Arguments: The government itself has been a source of misinformation, creating a conflict of interest in regulating misinformation.
The submission questions the safety and efficacy of mRNA Covid-19 vaccines, citing adverse events and questioning their effectiveness.
The submission argues that the government suppressed alternative Covid-19 treatments and enforced ineffective measures like lockdowns and mask mandates.
The submission raises concerns about the influence of private interests on health organizations like the TGA, WHO, and FDA.
The submission emphasizes the importance of freedom of expression and warns against censorship under the guise of protecting Australians from harm.
Notable Quotes: It is easy to believe that we are all in agreement when those who disagree are silenced.
I believe the increase of censorship in the guise of protecting Australians from harm is a worrying and disturbing trend toward silencing anyone who questions those in power.
Who is the arbiter in determining what is correct information and what is 'misinformation', and how do they make this judgement?
